goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time. It can also help us identify any outliers or anomalies.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the airport with the highest number of flights and can help us understand the popularity of certain airports.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of cancelled flights in the dataset and can help us identify any patterns or trends in cancellations.

goals.question: What is the average flight speed?
goals.visualization: Box plot of distance divided by air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of flight speeds and can help us identify any outliers or anomalies in the data.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-5k.json')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['departure_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['departure_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['departure_time'])]

# Create histogram of departure_delay
sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', kde=True, color='blue')

# Add vertical line for median delay time
median_delay = data['departure_delay'].median()
plt.axvline(median_delay, color='red', linestyle='dashed', label=f'Median delay: {median_delay:.2f}')

# Set chart title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
plt.xlabel('Departure delay (minutes)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

# Add legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-5k.json')

# Convert time fields to datetime
data['air_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['air_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with missing values
data = data.dropna()

# Create scatter plot
sns.scatterplot(x='distance', y='air_time', data=data)

# Add title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?')
plt.xlabel('Distance')
plt.ylabel('Air Time')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-5k.json')

# Plot bar chart of origin_airport
sns.set_style("whitegrid")
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
sns.countplot(x='origin_airport', data=data, order=data['origin_airport'].value_counts().index, palette='viridis')
plt.title('What is the most common origin airport?', wrap=True)
plt.xlabel('Origin Airport')
plt.ylabel('Number of Flights')
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.tight_layout()

chart = plt
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-5k.json')

# Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
cancelled = data['cancelled'].value_counts()
plt.pie(cancelled, labels=['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled'], autopct='%1.1f%%', colors=['#4CAF50', '#F44336'])
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?')

# Return plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-5k.json')

# Calculate flight speed
data['flight_speed'] = data['distance'] / data['air_time']

# Create box plot
sns.boxplot(x=data['flight_speed'], color='skyblue')

# Add title and labels
plt.title('What is the average flight speed?')
plt.xlabel('Flight Speed')
plt.ylabel('')

# Add median line
median = data['flight_speed'].median()
plt.axvline(x=median, color='red', label=f'Median: {median:.2f}')

# Show legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```
